Castle Grounds.description: The castle grounds are a small, open area with a few buildings and a few trees. The ground is covered in grass and dirt, and the buildings are mostly made of stone. The castle grounds are also a good place to rest.

Pantry.name: Pantry
Pantry.description: The pantry is a small, open area with a few buildings and a few trees. The ground is covered in grass and dirt, and the buildings are mostly made of stone. The castle grounds are also a good place to rest.

Granary.name: Granary
Granary.description: The Granary is a room in a barn for threshed grain. It is built above the ground to keep the stored food away from mice, other animals and floods.

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.description: The Kitchen is a room for food preparation and cooking. It can serve as a hideout and provide storage for weapons

Ballroom.name: Ballroom
Ballroom.description: The Ball Room is a large formal room inside a building for holding large parties called balls.

Dining Room.name: Dinning Room
Dining Room.description: The Dining Room is used for eating meals. Other activities such playing board games may also take place in the dinning room

Armory.name: Armory
Armory.description: An Armory is a supply of arms for defending and attacking. It can also be a place where arms are manufactured. It is a well guarded place

Great Hall.name: Great Hall
Great Hall.description: The Great Hall is the main room in the house. It serves as a safe place for groups to retreat to in times of danger.

Hallway.name: Hallway
Hallway.description: The Hallway is the area of the house that connect the bedrooms.

Bed Chamber I.name: Bed Chamber I
Bed Chamber I.description: The Bed Chamber is used for sleeping, resting and healing

Bed Chamber III.name: Bed Chamber III
Bed Chamber III.description: The Bed Chamber is used for sleeping, resting and healing

Stable.name: Stable
Stable.description: The stable is a building for the lodging and feeding of horses, cattle, etc. such a building with stalls. It most commonly means a building that is divided into separate stalls for individual animals and livestock.

Parapet.name: Parapet
Parapet.description: The parapet is a barrier that is an extension of the wall at the edge of a roof, terrace, balcony, walkway or other structure. The word comes ultimately from the Italian parapetto (parare 'to cover/defend' and petto 'chest/breast').

Garden.name: Garden
Garden.description: A garden  is A garden is a planned space, usually outdoors, set aside for the cultivation, display, and enjoyment of plants and other forms of nature. The single feature identifying even the wildest wild garden is control. The garden can incorporate both natural and artificial materials.

Throne Room.name: Throne Room
Throne Room.description: A throne room in the official residence of the leader, either a palace or a fortified castle, where the throne of a senior figure (usually a monarch) is set up with elaborate pompâ€”usually raised, often with steps, and under a canopy, both of which are part of the original notion of the Greek word thronos.

Bed Chamber II.description: A bed chamber a room used for sleeping in
